messages.text:
Heya <@U01AKGWGLC8> and <@U03UMPD2NNS> - do we have any plans for rebranding/retheming of our brands in 2026?

For context, this year we had a KR for full adoption of Zest which we didn't prioritize so we didn't meet it (~60 files still need updates per brand), but if we have some rebranding plans, we should add this back into our roadmaps so we can leverage UI2 on Zest

elements.text:
- do we have any plans for rebranding/retheming of our brands in 2026?

For context, this year we had a KR for full adoption of Zest which we didn't prioritize so we didn't meet it (~60 files still need updates per brand), but if we have some rebranding plans, we should add this back into our roadmaps so we can leverage UI2 on Zest

_thread_replies.text: There's a general objective to do a brand refresh next year with an external agency - but Yury said they wouldn't kick this off until second part of the year

elements.text: There's a general objective to do a brand refresh next year with an external agency - but Yury said they wouldn't kick this off until second part of the year

_thread_replies.text: In general as we create new components now we do use Zest

_thread_replies.text: Nothing concrete on the TPT side, but this might change :slightly_smiling_face:

messages.text:
Just dropping an idea for consideration.
As far as I remember, there are 2 in-office days defined by the org, and the 3rd one is selected by the tribe. Which are those from Tue-Thu-Fri?
It seems that the rooms are occupied mostly on Tuesday and Thursday, so if we can shift one of these in-office days, that might be an option :dunno:

root.text:
Quick heads-up on a growing problem: the new room assignment for WoCo means that our tribe + the AX folks on the 3rd floor are essentially out of meeting space,  since we lost *Panna Cotta* and *Gulab Jamun*.

Finding a spot for a simple standup is already a challenge (we are having a room on a 4th floor), and it's going to be a disaster when everyone is back in 2026.
Office Management <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C046QQ3TVJ5/p1763459311701469|isn't responding to our team's request>.  <@UEZ4PRFKM> <@U03TY4YJU4X> You are probably in the best position to raise this issue and ask office management for solutions.

elements.text:
Hi everyone,
A quick heads-up regarding meeting room availability on the 3rd floor:

With the Works Council (WoCo) moving into their new space, the meeting rooms

, effective immediately.

All existing and future bookings in these two rooms have been removed.

Please update any recurring meetings you may have scheduled there.
All other 3rd-floor rooms remain available as usual.

Keep a look out in your email for more information on larger company seating changes coming later this week.

attachments.fallback:
[November 18th, 2025 1:48 AM] hf.workplace.office: :loudspeaker: *Meeting Room Update – Ritterstraße*

Hi everyone,
A quick heads-up regarding meeting room availability on the 3rd floor:

With the Works Council (WoCo) moving into their new space, the meeting rooms *Gulab Jamun* and *Panna Cotta* are now *exclusively reserved for the WoCo*, effective immediately.

All existing and future bookings in these two rooms have been removed.
 :point_right: Please update any recurring meetings you may have scheduled there.
All other 3rd-floor rooms remain available as usual.

Keep a look out in your email for more information on larger company seating changes coming later this week.

messages.text:
*tl;dr:* Folks, unfortunately, there is no quick solution to the issue at hand.

*Context:* Unfortunately, for cost-saving reasons, the ground floor quiet area will be subleased to another company, which means that that space will become unavailable for HF. Unfortunately, legally, WoCo does need access to secure, private rooms. Furthermore, because it's a "smart building" it's impossible to create additional meeting rooms quickly.

*Immediate Solution:* We increase the usage of Mezzanine, the meeting room in the Mezzanine and the long table in the corridor on the other side of our room.

*Mid-Term Solution:* The mezzanine space will be improved and separated into sections to increase access and utilization of the space. There will be a conference space, a individual meeting space and an easy way to get to the meeting room without disturbing participants in the conference space. The workspace team will consider increasing the quantity of phonebooths as well to compensate partially.

elements.text: Folks, unfortunately, there is no quick solution to the issue at hand.

Unfortunately, for cost-saving reasons, the ground floor quiet area will be subleased to another company, which means that that space will become unavailable for HF. Unfortunately, legally, WoCo does need access to secure, private rooms. Furthermore, because it's a "smart building" it's impossible to create additional meeting rooms quickly.
We increase the usage of Mezzanine, the meeting room in the Mezzanine and the long table in the corridor on the other side of our room.

The mezzanine space will be improved and separated into sections to increase access and utilization of the space. There will be a conference space, a individual meeting space and an easy way to get to the meeting room without disturbing participants in the conference space. The workspace team will consider increasing the quantity of phonebooths as well to compensate partially.

_thread_replies.text: <@UEZ4PRFKM> would you know what is the project we should use for BNL migration?

_thread_replies.text:
This is a good question... I don't think we have a KR in TAM that can be well attributed for this work - any ideas <@U03TY4YJU4X>? :thinking_face:

The PRD mentions leveraging new monetization models (ie: premium tier), but I see most existing KRs for teams are not generic enough or are cancelled. ie: ACT-T-19, CONS-S-67

elements.text: This is a good question... I don't think we have a KR in TAM that can be well attributed for this work - any ideas

_thread_replies.text: Let me know once we have an option then I will complete IT Cap for the team

elements.text: Let me know once we have an option then I will complete IT Cap for the team

_thread_replies.text: Why don't we take the ACT-A-8-Subscription flexibility: Reduce cancellations cumulatively by 5%, as measured by A/B experiments for the time being? It's generic enough

elements.text: Why don't we take the ACT-A-8-Subscription flexibility: Reduce cancellations cumulatively by 5%, as measured by A/B experiments for the time being? It's generic enough

_thread_replies.text: Sounds good. I will use that for the team. Thanks.

elements.text: Sounds good. I will use that for the team. Thanks.

_thread_replies.text: <@U03TY4YJU4X> it should be fine to attribute to that KR even if its labelled as DO NOT MEET right? I know they mostly care about not attributing to DONE or CANCELLED KRs

elements.text: it should be fine to attribute to that KR even if its labelled as DO NOT MEET right? I know they mostly care about not attributing to DONE or CANCELLED KRs

_thread_replies.text: It's not cancelled :smile:
so yes, it's just that we don't meet the value. Cancelled or done would indicate that we already got the value (or don't plan to get it); hence can't capiutalize

elements.text: so yes, it's just that we don't meet the value. Cancelled or done would indicate that we already got the value (or don't plan to get it); hence can't capiutalize

_thread_replies.text: Ooh good question, what do we have for Factor Form generally? We could go for a conversion metric there, or revenue

elements.text: Ooh good question, what do we have for Factor Form generally? We could go for a conversion metric there, or revenue

_thread_replies.text:
in general, we have these main projects for Factor Form:
• TAM-A-47-VMS: Drive towards achieving 15,690 net conversions for Factor Form by the end of 2025, in alignment with the 2025 business plan.
• TAM-A-14-VMS: Launch One-Time Purchase in the Factor Form funnel with supporting tech infrastructure that can be leveraged by HFG by the end of Q2 2025
• TAM-T-20-VMS: Launch 2 additional delivery cadences for Factor Form products that actives can select
